name: Le Nouvel Hotel & Spa

reviews.text: I booked the hotel on Priceline and received a great rate. When I arrived, the front desk advised that the King bed reserved was not available. They offered me a condo suite for the same price. It was outstanding!
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived to Montreal airport and took the shuttle bus to this hotel, just a couple of stops about 30 mins. Nice reception but room not ready early evening. When we did get into the room it was large but basic. No fridge, no kettle just a coffee machine. Ice machine available. Beds and pillos were comfortable and bathroom adequate. Several of the electrical sockets looked dangerous and there needs to be some updating generally. There was a good continental breakfast in the morning. There is a small courtyard to enjoy a drink in the evening. Reception staff were very understanding of our lack of French.
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.text: Good location for Catherine Street (about 20 mins) where there is a variety of shops and the atmosphere in the evening was very cosmopolitan and lovely to stoll along. The train station is less than 15 mins away.
reviews.title: A fine place to stay in Montreal

reviews.text: I stayed at Le Nouvel with a group of friends when we were in Montreal for the Grand Prix. It is in downtown close to the Metro, so it's easy to get around. It has large comfortable rooms and friendly helpful staff.
reviews.title: Fits the Bill

reviews.text: My friends and I stayed here for Grand Prix weekend and the hotel staff could not have been more accomodating. The value and location is excellent. It is only two blocks to St. Catherine street and the Metro station.The only downside is that some rooms could use some renovation to make them all more equal in quality. That said, all of them were clean with the comfortable beds and good hot showers we needed after spending long days at the track. The buffet breakfast is not included, but the food was varied and plentifull. Overall a very good experience lead by an excellent hotel staff.
reviews.title: A comfortable place to stay at a good price.......

reviews.text: Located along the main street with metro stations / bus stations within five to ten minutes walk, this Hotel would be so good for those travelling around the city by public transport ! The room we had for a group of four was neat and spacious. Though dining facilities would be considered a cons, the overall pros took dominant side and won our recommendation for others. Besides, there were a great variety of choices for food within fifteen minutes walk in the area !
reviews.title: Good location & Price

reviews.text: Although this hotel was not in the middle of the action it is in a very nice section of Montreal and only a few minutes walk from dozens of restaurants on Rue Crescent. Although this is not a five star hotel, it does get a 4+ rating due to the value and the attentive service from the staff. If you want to get to old Montreal, you will need to take a cab or the Metro, but you will find that the restaurants nearby are a better value and are a bit more genuine.
reviews.title: This was a great value at a great location

reviews.text: Parking is available for $15/day right under the hotel and includes in/out privileges. I got a great rate from Travelocity and the hotel treated me like royalty even though paid a cut rate. When we arrived we had an issue with our remote, which turned out to be the TV. The good news was that the maintenance staff arrived 5 minutes after my call and ended up replacing the TV within the next 5 minutes.
reviews.title: Very good hotel for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through Hotwire so we got a fine rate for this 3-star hotel. It's clean, stylish in an understated way, and the desk clerks were all uniformly helpful. The location is very good, not great, at the west end of downtown, close to St. Catherine a key artery. Lots of fine restaurants and shops within walking distance. I might choose to stay in Old Montreal next visit. The rooms were not huge but adequate. We had an older TV (not flat screen). Still there was a nice, modern, friendly feeling to the place. I could recommend it.
reviews.title: Very good condo rooms at Le Nouvel Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception areas are large, open and comfortable. There is a lovely garden area just near the reception area with lots of pretty flower. The condo rooms are at the back so are very quiet and provide a kitchenette with microwave, kettle, toaster and cooktop so you can eat in if you want to. Not the there is a shortage of restaurants just a short walk away in rue St. Catherine. Generally a nice area of town and a very pleasant hotel.
reviews.title: WE with my hubby

reviews.text: Checked in this afternoon on a prebooked arrangement to be told thete would be no running water from 7am to 5pm tomorrow. If I hadn't been prebooked I would have gone elsewhere. The guy at reception said there is nothing they can do..'the city only told them today', another way of saying not my problem. A poor show - stay elsewhere.
reviews.title: No water!

reviews.text: It is refreshing to see pride in the staff of this hotel. Everyone is very friendly and helpful. We had a large room with a queen size bed and a pullout couch. We were in room 801. It had a pretty view of a lovely church with lots of green space. There was a fridge and a microwave. There is a pretty patio and lovely lobby. We used express deals on Priceline. We really lucked out!
reviews.title: Super!

reviews.text: my wife and i stay at this hotel every year for the fantasia film festival. It's a great place, clean, the rooms are big and well kept. It's also got 24 hour desk service so there's always someone there if you should need help or assistance. We look forward to staying there every year for about 10 days. I would highly recommend Le Nouvel Hotel for a comfortable stay in Montreal.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: Clean. Contemporary reception. Staff good. Breakfast was fine - quiet clean dining area. Waited a long time for coffee but everything else was self serve. All other meals in local restaurants. Wide range of choice with 1 mile.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Room clean and air conditioned. Coffee in room. Bathroom well maintained. Wifi included and works well.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel in a lively area

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. We paid 100 CAD per night, which not included breakfast, free WiFi, rooms needs to be updated. But a lot of cafe and restaurants where you can get breakfast cheaper than in hotel (6-10 CAD per person, compare 18 CAD in hotel). Location is not bad, quite, 15 min walk to downtown and Mount Royal Park, easy access to transportation. But let me tell you about staff. They are amazing, professional, very helpful. Special thanks to Barbara, Alex, Denis, Jennifer. Keep it up!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Amazing staff!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 1 night in a Standard King room on the 6th floor. Prepare to step back in time with this hotel, the room was in need of a good renovation. It was damp feeling and smelt musky. The air conditioner was loud and the TV was a tube. The drapes would not close, so it made for a very bright wakeup call. The bed was comfy, but the pillows were flat like pancakes. The bathroom lighting was less than flattering and there were hairs left in the tub and around the sink from previous guests. Aside from the quality of the amenities, the staff is friendly and it is a very convenient location, only a short walk to Rue St. Catherine (Shopping, Restaurants).
reviews.title: Basic hotel, not very nice

reviews.text: When I researched Le Nouvel Hotel the advertisement read "4 star hotel & spa" and the pics were very nice. When I arrived I instantly knew that the advertisement was somewhat false. My first unexpected surprise was that parking was $15 per day. The next unexpected surprise was that everything in the building and room were ancient old! The furniture & TV in the room was at least from the 1990's. I rated the hotel average because I'll admit that the room was clean & did not have any bugs. The hotel staff was polite and hotel is located a block from major shopping and restaurants.
reviews.title: Unexpected quality.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Relaxing, peaceful stay. We stayed in the Executive King which only means that the room is located on the top floor (8th) not a sky scraper. Outside is plain, square unpainted building. Inside looks more pleasing. Room is larger than other hotel rooms I have stayed but smaller than I expected comparing it to pictures in the website. Staff was very professional and nice. They have a business center. They have a pool and fitness room but did not use it. A restaurant for an extra charge. no free breakfast. No fridge or microwave in room. Ice machine is on the basement, too far if you are on the top floors. They have a disinfectant dispenser at the lobby elevator but was empty the whole time we stayed there. Lastly, they provide you a complimentary 2 bottled water which was nice in the summer but they ran out during our last night of stay. they actually ran out on our 5th night night and I have to ask the front desk for the water every night which they had to search for extras from other rooms. Very convenient to tourist areas like Rue Catherine, underground city and Old Montreal(15 blocks). You can always use STM (metro/bus). 3/ride, 9/day, 18/3 day, 12/weekend and other price rates.
reviews.title: Relaxing 7 nights

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in Montreal and I have there is no free lunch in the world. I paid about $100 a night and so I did not have my expectations too high to begin with. The location of the hotel is near Guy-Concordia and you can walk about 10 minutes to the red line or green line metro. The neighborhood is so so but safe. Parking is separate from the hotel and you pay $15 a night to the attendant, and the condition of the garage is so so. The hotel room is kind of old and the AC smells a little when you first turn it on, but water pressure is actually pretty good. The sleep quality of the hotel is so so, and at least I don't hear what is going on in the other rooms like what happened to me when I stayed at the Key Bridge Marriott in DC. Overall, this is not a bad hotel given the price I paid, but it is also not a place I would like to stay for an extended period of time.
reviews.title: You get what you paid for

description: To experience an entirely new level of hospitality excellence, choose the accommodations of our Three-Diamond hotel in Montreal. Le Nouvel Hotel and Spa is also the ideal choice for professional business meetings and elegant social affairs, whether you choose our own flexible banquet halls or the nearby Montreal Convention Center
